intro: Cissus gardneri, commonly known as the African snow vine, is a climbing plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by edible, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often used in ornamental gardening. Its rapid growth and ability to climb make it a popular choice for trellises and hanging baskets.
